ui-label: Mole Concentration Of Hexachlorobiphenyl In Air
description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for hexachlorobiphenyl is C12H4Cl6.  This structure of this species consists of two linked benzene rings, each of which is additionally bonded to three chlorine atoms.
